intro: Rubus arduennensis var. uncifer, commonly known as the Arduennian blackberry, is a variant of the blackberry plant native to specific regions of Europe. It is characterized by its dark purple to black berries, which are typically small and tart. The plant has thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Its botanical significance lies in its unique genetic traits and ecological role in local ecosystems.
